source.content: September 30  Filed Under Blog Post Events Impact Clarity Strategy A day long training workshop with Lynn Fergusson hosted by the Sustainability Network We’ll provide an overview of strategic planning and our approach to tying it to impact in a concrete actionable and inspiring way We’ll provide examples then share tools and give you a chance to get your feet wet You’ll get feedback from coaches and peers to take back with you We’ll also look at how we can use measurement and evaluation change management and a learning agenda to build your organization’s planning capacity so that you’ll be able to see what’s changing and adapt your strategic plan as you go By the end of the day you’ll be ready to show your organization that you have been thinking ahead and you’re ready to make the most of your strategic planning process When Thursday December 12 00 AM to 400 PM Where Centre for Social Innovation  Spadina Avenue Toronto ON Registration Cost  per person or  per person for more than 2

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are several events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 events would not be feasible within the given constraints. Instead, I will mention a few notable events and initiatives related to environmental conservation:

1. United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) COP16 - This conference brings together governments, civil society organizations, and indigenous peoples to discuss and negotiate international agreements related to biological diversity and ecosystem health.
2. World Wildlife Day - March 3rd celebrates the world's wild animals and plants. It raises awareness of the importance of conserving the natural world and its resources.
3. Earth Day - April 2nd is dedicated to promoting environmental awareness and encouraging actions to protect our planet.
4. Global Landscapes Forum - This event brings together stakeholders from around the world to address land use issues and promote sustainable landscape management.
5. Conference of Parties (COP) - These annual meetings under the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) bring together representatives from countries to discuss and negotiate global responses to climate change.
6. World Environmental Education Congress - Organized by the International Environmental Education Association (IEEA), this congress gathers educators, policymakers, and practitioners to exchange ideas and best practices in environmental education.
7. Ramsar Convention on Wetlands - Established in 197, this intergovernmental treaty focuses on the conservation and wise use of wetlands and their resources.
8. Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) - The IPCC provides scientific advice to governments on climate change mitigation and adaptation strategies.
9. Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Fauna and Flora (CITES) - This convention regulates international trade in species threatened with extinction.
10. Bonn Challenge - This global initiative aims to restore 15 million hectares of degraded and deforested lands by 2020.

source.content: impact Measurement is the most straightforward Just like a carpenter with a ruler and pencil measurement refers to the process of tracking progress on some kind of numerical or subjective scale Total income number of employees market share number of people served and annual growth are all measurements While care and consideration are needed to set the goal actually determining whether it has been met is not a complicated process – although determining what to measure can be an important strategic decision Assessment is more involved Employee questionnaires client testimonials and feedback from other organizations are all forms of assessment Most assessment in the not-for-profit sector involves manipulation or correlation of data Examples might include an analysis of the number of dollars required to reach a given goal a comparison of the relative impact of different employee assignments or a comparison of outcomes in differently served populations While measurement serves to determine

source.content: May 16  Filed Under Authentic Engagement Blog Post Collective Impact Featured Uncategorised Lynn Fergussen from Social Impact Advisors connects with Tamer Ibrahim and Kate Flynn about the collective impact process what it is like to be a backbone and lessons learned from the field Collective impact is defined as a group of organizations working together to address a major challenge by developing an integrated approach that fundamentally improves population -level outcomes in a community Social Impact Advisors currently provides coaching support to a wide range of Collectives that seek to impact social and environmental change Collectives often include institutions nonprofits public service agencies and for-profit businesses aligned around a common goal Tamer Ibrahim Youth Collective Impact Manager at Laidlaw Foundation and Chair of the Board at For Youth Initiative; and Katherine Flynn General Manager at Centre for Climate Change Management at Mohawk College Tamer shares his insights

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: The company offers 5 key products that can be delivered individually or combined in different ways. These products include engaging and impactful session designs, teaching concepts and sharing knowledge, providing guidance and coaching, aligning teams around a clear statement of purpose, creating visual representations of action plans, and helping teams build confidence in their refined and validated strategies. Additionally, the company leverages its experience working with numerous organizations to share examples and best practices, further supporting client success.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: There are several employment and educational opportunities mentioned in the provided text. For example, TAF (The Atmospheric Fund) is offering grants to support potential grantees through their online, on-demand "Designing for Climate Change" program. Additionally, RBC Future Launch Fund is accepting applications for initiatives aimed at preparing Canadian youth for the jobs of tomorrow. Furthermore, Community Foundation Canada's Indigenous Peoples Resilience Fund has recently released more funding for impact initiatives who have completed their development coaching. Lastly, the Sustainability Network is seeking collaboration with ENGOs to define where the ENGO community needs and wants to be in the next 10 years and identify capacity challenges and gaps that must be addressed to achieve this vision. These opportunities provide various paths for individuals to engage in meaningful work or continue their education within the fields related to climate change, youth empowerment, and community development.

source.content: undergraduate career She also has experience as an Outreach and Events Director at the Muslim Students Association at the University of Toronto throughout her undergrad She is currently completing qualitative analysis in her current research project exploring social network factors that may be impacting Type 2 Diabetes management and prevention in South Asian communities in the Peel region Through these opportunities she has experience observing and assessing the needs and gaps of equity-deserving populations She has completed a masters level course on program evaluation with knowledge conducting population needs analyses and environmental scans Louisa is also a second year OT student who has dedicated over  hours to non-profit organizations and community partners in the greater Montreal Area Her experience working with different populations is diverse including working with all ages such as children as young as the age of 2 to older adults aged  Her current research includes the

We are keen to be working with the Sustainability Network on their Vision  to define where the ENGO community needs and wants to be in the next 10 years and what capacity challenges and gaps need to be addressed to get there  We’re hopeful to be able to gather in the Spring for a final in-person working session of ENGOs across Canada  We’re glad to be returning to support the Halton Youth Collective Program led by the Oakville Community Foundation under the Halton Region Community Safety and Wellbeing table This is the second year of a pilot program to support youth transitioning from care with Halton CAS and the collective is supporting this pilot while simultaneously turning its attention to the systems changes needed to support more CAS youth being satisfied with their employment education and training   Congratulations to TAF The Atmospheric Fund for rolling out their final grant round of ‘21 providing additional support to potential grantees through our online on-demand Designing

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Throughout the provided text, there are several mentions of benefits that may be relevant to employees or participants involved in various initiatives or programs. Some notable examples include:

1. Accessibility and inclusion: Organizations such as Blue Door Shelter, Wellspring Chinguacousy, and Northern Lights Collaborative prioritize accessibility and inclusion for diverse groups of people, including those with disabilities. By doing so, they create opportunities for personal growth and development while fostering a sense of belonging within the community.
2. Professional development: Innoweave's Impact Strategic Clarity stream offers employees the chance to enhance their professional skills and gain valuable insights for organizational planning and decision-making. Similarly, the Youth Collective Impact Planning module offered by Laidlaw Foundation provides young people with opportunities to develop essential life skills and explore potential career paths.
3. Alignment and communication: Both the Strategic Planning workshop facilitated by Social Impact Advisors and the B Corp movement emphasize the importance of aligning organizational goals and communicating the impact of an organization's work on the lives of others. This helps build trust among stakeholders and reinforces the significance of the organization's mission.
4. Opportunities for learning and growth: Participants in various modules and workshops are given the chance to learn from experienced professionals, share ideas, and collaborate with others in their field. This not only strengthens their individual skill sets but also contributes to the collective progress towards achieving common goals.

source.content: October is National Disability Employment Awareness Month The awareness month was established to increase awareness of the positive outcomes that come from hiring people with disabilities in Canada SIA is striving to deepen our understanding of equity and how we can increase positive outcomes for individuals with disabilities in the workplace  We invite you to tune into the recent  Project podcast which focuses on the experience of individuals with disabilities living in poverty Titled “Trapped behind the Welfare Wall on Disability Assistance” this episode shares a first-hand perspective from Trevor Manson and Andrea Hatala Chairs of Ontario Disability Support Program Action Coalition Listen here  Learn more about how your business can create a more inclusive working environment by visiting the Ontario Disability Employment Centre website Their website also features a short quiz that will test your current knowledge on the population of individuals with disabilities in Ontario Take

of their clients are non-profit They have been making the benefits of technology affordable and accessible to all organizations including those with limited resources for more than twenty years    In today’s episode Ian Kelly General Manager and Elaine Adema Account Manager at Peaceworks talk about what motivates them about the B Corp movement what the certification process is like and the evolution of new B Corp standards around the world They talk about how employees and customers respond to and are motivated by the B Corp mission and the hope it brings    Twitter LinkedIn Certified B Corporation Ontario Nonprofit Network Bullfrog powered Moccassin We respectfully acknowledge that our offices are located on the traditional territory of the Haudenesaunee and Anishnaabeg This territory is covered by the Upper Canada Treaties and directly adjacent to Haldimand Treaty territory ©  Social Impact Advisors Inc    Log in

source.content: April 20  Filed Under Featured Impact Clarity Impact Investing Podcast Social Finance Tim shares insights into Socially Responsible Investing – about people looking to do less evil and perhaps more good with their investments Even more importantly we look beyond that to his business model aimed at helping one million Canadians invest intentionally because of the difference he sees that will make in the world  He’s creating a movement and shares how he’ll accomplish this based on his Theory of Change or Change Theory  This approach has Tim acting as a coach helping empower people to invest in line with their values  We see how by having a big goal of helping one million people it’s driven his activity including realizing that a move to making his offerings virtual is a powerful path to get there  Twitter LinkedIn Certified B Corporation Ontario Nonprofit Network Bullfrog powered Moccassin We respectfully acknowledge that our offices are located on the traditional territory of the

September 30  Filed Under Blog Post Events Impact Clarity Strategy A day long training workshop with Lynn Fergusson hosted by the Sustainability Network We’ll provide an overview of strategic planning and our approach to tying it to impact in a concrete actionable and inspiring way We’ll provide examples then share tools and give you a chance to get your feet wet You’ll get feedback from coaches and peers to take back with you We’ll also look at how we can use measurement and evaluation change management and a learning agenda to build your organization’s planning capacity so that you’ll be able to see what’s changing and adapt your strategic plan as you go By the end of the day you’ll be ready to show your organization that you have been thinking ahead and you’re ready to make the most of your strategic planning process When Thursday December 12 00 AM to 400 PM Where Centre for Social Innovation  Spadina Avenue Toronto ON Registration Cost  per person or  per person for more than 2

August 18  Filed Under Featured Impact Clarity Impact Investing Podcast Strategy Laura Manning Executive Director at the Lyle S Hallman Foundation LSHF shares the journey and lessons learned from a bold Canadian pilot started in  granting significant additional unrestricted General Operating Support GOS to known grantees  We hear about the time it takes to get boards comfortable with this approach and what’s behind that We also hear how Laura and the Foundation see advocating for this approach as part of their work to help shift the sector  Now issuing more than 70 of the Foundation’s grants in unrestricted General Operating Support LSHF provides insights and a framework in a Canadian context and encouragement to Canadian funders to take a closer look at unrestricted giving as a way to enable impact Twitter LinkedIn Certified B Corporation Ontario Nonprofit Network Bullfrog powered Moccassin We respectfully acknowledge that our offices are located on the traditional territory of the

October 19  Filed Under Collective Impact Impact Investing Leadership Philanthropy Podcast Social Finance Strategy In this episode of Impact Conversations Bill Young the founder of Social Capital Partners joins Lynn to talk about creating impact in systems Bill’s extensive business experience and social enterprise successes have given him some important insights about learning through experimentation pivoting as ideas and opportunities present themselves and trusting in management teams and their Theories of Change Bill founded Social Capital Partners in  and has been one of the leading voices in promoting social finance in Canada He also sits on a variety of boards and advisory boards for social enterprises and community organizations Bill previously spent 20 years in the private sector primarily as CEO of Hamilton Computers and Optel Communications Corp later Axxent He holds an Honours BA from the University of Toronto an MBA from the Harvard Business School and is a Chartered

source.content: between organizations has brought about new opportunities for multi-sectoral solutions Efforts to find strategies that “multi-solve” for interconnected social and environmental problems have emerged with organizations coming together to tackle systemic issues We are encouraged by this form of collective action and look forward to seeing this work build in the new year Innovation The innovation seen across the sector during this time has been remarkable We have enjoyed online conferences webinars and engagement opportunities that remind us of the importance of social connection We’ve seen countless organizations work tirelessly to adapt to emerging needs in an unpredictable context finding new ways to support and strengthen their communities We are hopeful that this next year will bring further innovation and community-building as we look to heal and rebuild through and beyond the pandemic As we close out the year we wish you hope and joy this season Twitter LinkedIn Certified B

and organizations we work with to think about the future in a new way There are no roadmaps no best practices to learn from the plane is truly being built and flown at the same time However across the sector some themes are emerging as top of mind for organizations and their leaders Our goal is to highlight some of these themes and share the questions organizations are asking and some promising approaches that may be helpful to others We’re all learning together Over the next two blog posts we want to look at changing organizational structures and how teams are adapting to environments that are in constant flux Leaders are asking themselves “What is the right organizational design What combination of virtual teams and services and in-person engagement is right How will our virtual team be managed and how will we make decisions well What new skills and experience will we need” and maybe most importantly “What is my ‘organization of the future’ going to look like” As we touch on this

November 18  Filed Under Blog Post Impact Clarity Social Innovation Strategy There is no roadmap it all seems so overwhelming but you are doing it you ARE managing the crisis  We’re fortunate to be part of a group of nine inspiring women coaches working with the McConnell Foundation in the Innoweave Impact and Strategic Clarity Coaches’ Community of Practice  Many members of this small group have been working in coaching and consulting with the nonprofit and philanthropic sectors for decades and have been connected to one another since   Our learning and growing together has been rich and varied We work with nonprofit public sector and philanthropic leaders in planning for the future These leaders want to ensure they make the best use of talent and resources to create positive social and environmental impact in the world COVID-19 has of course caused all of us and the people and organizations we work with to think about the future in a new way There are no roadmaps no best practices to

December 16  Filed Under Blog Post Holiday Social Innovation As we reflect on the past year we are hopeful about the opportunities for healing and rebuilding we see within communities This year the pandemic and global movements around Black Lives Matter and Indigenous rights have exposed long-standing inequities within our systems We are inspired by our partners’ and clients’ generosity collaboration and innovation during these uncertain times Generosity Although many organizations are stretched for resources and capacity we are seeing them readjust and reorient programs to continue to serve those most in need We have seen individuals and organizations be generous with their time knowledge and resources We are thankful for the unique gifts they bring Collaboration The increased collaboration between organizations has brought about new opportunities for multi-sectoral solutions Efforts to find strategies that “multi-solve” for interconnected social and environmental problems have

September 2  Filed Under Featured Philanthropy Podcast Social Innovation Lee St James founded Social Robots to apply her tech background to a social issue close to home  Not able to spend as much time with her father while seeing the effects of social isolation she took action Through this social enterprise and with help from an Investment Readiness Program grant from the Community Foundations of Canada through the Oakville Community Foundation Lee is piloting the use of a friendly robot complete with a tablet for interactive apps and photos to engage seniors in retirement homes and long term care facilities  She’s addressing issues of social isolation and boredom while providing an interesting tool for Rec leaders to engage with their senior residents and seeing positive results  With a heightened awareness of the issue of social isolation due to COVID-19 Lee is seeing growing interest and particularly from post-secondary institutions looking to embed this in their curriculum to

These partnerships likely aim to tackle important issues together and share resources to maximize impact. Additionally, they might engage with other B Corporations, certified by the same standard, which promotes a better way of doing business.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Through collaboration, organizations aim to achieve shared goals and desired outcomes. Some common mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations include:

1. Resource sharing: Organizations can pool resources such as funding, expertise, and infrastructure to maximize efficiency and effectiveness.
2. Consensus building: Collaborating allows organizations to reach a shared understanding of complex issues and develop joint positions or recommendations.
3. Scale and sustainability: By working together, organizations can expand the reach and impact of their initiatives, ensuring long-term success.
4. Learning and innovation: Collaborative efforts provide opportunities for organizations to exchange ideas, best practices, and lessons learned, fostering continuous improvement and innovation.
5. Community impact: Joint projects and initiatives can lead to more significant and lasting improvements in communities served by participating organizations.
6. Advocacy and policy change: Collaborative efforts can help organizations amplify their voices and advocate for policies and systemic changes that align with their missions and values.
7. Capacity building: Working together can enhance individual organization's capabilities, enabling them to better respond to evolving challenges and opportunities.

between organizations has brought about new opportunities for multi-sectoral solutions Efforts to find strategies that “multi-solve” for interconnected social and environmental problems have emerged with organizations coming together to tackle systemic issues We are encouraged by this form of collective action and look forward to seeing this work build in the new year Innovation The innovation seen across the sector during this time has been remarkable We have enjoyed online conferences webinars and engagement opportunities that remind us of the importance of social connection We’ve seen countless organizations work tirelessly to adapt to emerging needs in an unpredictable context finding new ways to support and strengthen their communities We are hopeful that this next year will bring further innovation and community-building as we look to heal and rebuild through and beyond the pandemic As we close out the year we wish you hope and joy this season Twitter LinkedIn Certified B

approach ensuring all voices are heard and sessions are productive  We design for engagement focused on impact whether in virtual or in-person sessions Because we don’t just hand you a solution we teach concepts and share knowledge to guide you through each part of the process building your capacity to do the work at hand and beyond  We deliver 5 key products individually and in various combinations that can be applied at the organizational level as well as at a project level or for cross-sector groups of organizations  We leverage our experience with hundreds of organizations sharing examples while guiding and coaching your team to greater clarity and alignment We get your team aligned on a clear statement of the meaningful difference you are going to make and excited to take it on  We work with your team to create a clear 1-page graphic of what you must do to achieve your intended impact Our process will leave your team confident in their refined and validated plan ready to move to
